info.name: Centreon Web Rest API - Relevant test scripts
info.description:
# New features
+ Added real-time monitoring for hosts and services
+ Added acknowledgement for hosts and services
+ Added downtimes for hosts and services
+ Added the list of monitoring server configurations
+ Added the proxy configuration
# Information
All dates are in **ISO 8601** format
# Authentication
There are two modes of authentication:
* By token: after identification with your login credentials
* By cookie: by reusing a valid session ID


Contact Support:
 Name: Centreon

exec: pm.test("Account displayed in response corresponds to credentials", function (){

item.name: Update user's password with incorrect password format

exec: pm.test("Displayed error message is the one that's expected", function() {
pm.expect(responseJson.message).to.eql("[UserPassword::passwordValue] The value ({{currentPassword}}) doesn't match the regex '/[0-9]/'");
postman.setNextRequest("Update user's password with incorrect password format");
postman.setNextRequest("Update user's with correct password format");

item.name: Set parameters for newly created time period

exec: postman.setNextRequest("Set parameters for newly created time period");

item.name: Show available time periods after time period update

exec: if(pm.test("The value " + pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i])  + " was found for " + pm.collectionVariables.get("time_period_name") + "'s parameter " + parameters_to_check[i], function() {

item.name: Set exceptions on newly created time period

exec: pm.test("An exception has been set on " + pm.collectionVariables.get("current_exception_date") + " (Timerange: " + pm.collectionVariables.get("current_exception_timerange") + ")", function () {
postman.setNextRequest("Set exceptions on newly created time period");
postman.setNextRequest("Get exceptions on newly created time period");

item.name: Get exceptions on newly created time period

exec: pm.test("A list of exceptions has been returned.", function () {
pm.test("Exception date " + current_exception_date + " has been found.", function() {true;})
pm.test("Exception timerange for " + current_exception_date + " (" + current_exception_timerange + ") has been found.", function() {
pm.test("All exceptions have been found.", function() {

item.name: List all host groups with updated parameters

exec: pm.test("The value " + pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i])  + " was found for " + pm.collectionVariables.get("host_group_name") + "'s parameter " + parameters_to_check[i], function() {pm.expect(pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i])).to.eql(values[j]);})

pm.test("The value " + pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i]) + " was found for " + pm.collectionVariables.get("host_group_name") + "'s parameter " + parameters_to_check[i], function() {pm.expect(responseJson.result[l].icon.path).to.contain(pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i]))})

pm.test("The value " + pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i]) + " was found for " + pm.collectionVariables.get("host_group_name") + "'s parameter " + parameters_to_check[i], function() {pm.expect(responseJson.result[l].icon_map.path).to.contain(pm.collectionVariables.get(parameters_to_check[i]))})

request.description:
List all the hosts in real-time monitoring.

The available parameters to **search** / **sort_by** are:

* host.id
* host.name
* host.alias
* host.address
* host.state
* poller.id
* service.display_name
* host_group.id
* host.is_acknowledged
* host.downtime
* host.criticality
